data.description: If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online.Job SummaryWork as part of a team to provide support to ensure reliability, availability, efficiency, and functionality of all equipment, processes and projects.Job DescriptionKey Accountabilities Interface with engineering staff, operations & maintenance groups, and other Vistra personnel to ensure consistent, practical, and effective engineering solutionsRotate through different groups within the engineering department to gain a working knowledge of engineering functional areas.  Shadowing of other departments, to include, but are not limited to Operations, Maintenance, Radiation Protection and ChemistryWill be assigned various engineering projects based on prior experience and courses completedComply with safety policy and procedures to ensure a safe working environmentPossess the ability to work independently on assignments and problem solve with teams and in a dynamic environmentAll other duties as assignedEducation, Experience & Skill RequirementsMust be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident. Students sponsored through Optical Practical Training (OPT) or Curricular Practical Training (CPT) are NOT eligible for this internshipMust be currently enrolled in a 4-year institution of higher education and pursuing a Bachelor of Science or Master’s Degree in engineering, data science, or related disciplineExperience with programming languages, project management, Power BI, or machinery desiredProficient in Microsoft Office programs (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), Access Suite desiredExcellent verbal & written communication skills; presentation skills desiredOfficial transcripts must be received from your school prior to start dateMust be in good academic standing with your schoolJob FamilyGeneral ServicesCompanyVistra Nuclear Operations CompanyLocationsGlen Rose, TexasTexasWe are a company of people committed to:  Exceeding Customer Expectations, Great People, Teamwork, Competitive Spirit and Effective Communication.  If this describes you, then apply today!If you currently work for Vistra or its subsidiaries, please apply via the internal career site. It is the policy of the Company to comply with all employment laws and to afford equal employment opportunity to individuals in all aspects of employment, including in selection for job opportunities, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military service, protected veteran status, or any other consideration protected by federal, state or local laws. If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance submitting an application or would like to request an accommodation, please email us at assistance@vistraenergy.com to make a request.
requirements: Must be currently enrolled in a 4-year institution of higher education and pursuing a Bachelor of Science or Master’s Degree in engineering, data science, or related discipline
